p: Interestingly, phages can also directly influence human immunity. Recent research has shown phages to modulate both human innate and adaptive immunity (reviewed in [ 67]). One way in which phages can directly influence host immunity was described by Barr et al. as the Bacteriophage Adherence to Mucus model (BAM) [ 3]. In BAM, phages adhering to mucus reduce bacterial colonization of these surfaces, thereby protecting them from infection and disease [ 3].
